intro: Coccocypselum cordifolium, commonly known as the heart-leaf coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
